thread.title: Heartbreaking CCTV shows confused dog being tied to fence and left behind
thread.title_full: Heartbreaking CCTV shows confused dog being tied to fence and left behind | Central - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Heartbreaking CCTV shows confused dog being tied to fence and left behind
text:
Ella was tied to a fence and left there Credit: RSPCA The RSPCA is appealing for information after a poorly lurcher was found abandoned in Peterborough.
The dog was found tied to a fence with rope in Laburnum Grove on Thursday 9th February by a man who immediately alerted the RSPCA.
CCTV footage released today shows a man in dark-coloured clothing, with his hood up, walk over to the fence and tie her up before running away as she watches on.
Play video Inspector Justin Stubbs collected the tan-coloured dog, thought to be around four-years- old, and took her straight to a vet.
She looked so confused and frightened when I arrived, curled up on the ground with big clumps of fur missing.
“The little dog was tied to a fence with a ragged old bit of blue rope. Luckily, she was dumped outside a house with CCTV so we’re now able to release the footage of her being abandoned in the hope of finding the person responsible for such cruelty.
“Unfortunately, we receive thousands of calls every year about pets - particularly dogs - who have been coldly and callously dumped by their owners. To abandon any pet is shocking, but to do so in the depths of winter when they are in such poor condition is just heartless.”
– Inspector Justin Stubbs East Midlands Peterborough
